We just used YAGSL with a Pigeon 2 and updated odometry using Limelight with April tags.

Pretty simple and works well for us.

We updated our odom at 250hz, calibrated wheel size and gyro mount. After that the odom was pretty good with the something similar to a SwerveDriveOdometry / SwerveDrivePoseEstimator. I would highly advise looking at 6328’s open alliance from this year and previous years to learn how to have a good odometry, localization, and as a whole a good code base.

Pigeon IMU 1 and built-in NEO encoders were sufficient for a fairly reliable 4 ring auto. Code here:

GitHub

GitHub - FalconX-Robotics/FalconX-2024

Contribute to FalconX-Robotics/FalconX-2024 development by creating an account on GitHub.

If you elaborate more on your design goals with odometry and issues you had, people may be able to help more.
